intro: Diodia incana, commonly known as white diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and small, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in wetlands. Diodia incana is often found in wetland habitats and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
